ratings.comment: I thought this class was going to be easy and interesting, which is what 319 is all about. I didn't get that at all. He was  pretty unorganized, and went through the material too quickly . The tests at first were nothing like the review or homework assigned. Until he gets more practice teaching 319 I don't suggest him.

The first part of the class wasn't awful, but towards the end he started speeding through really tough material. He did his research on this material and doesn't understand why we don't get it the first time. He is open to questions. He makes LOTS of algebra mistakes and the accent can be hard to understand. I don't suggest him.

Prof Hernandez is a poor professor. He doesnt logically work out examples or describe the purpose of derivations while doing only the easiest problems. Poor tests too I got all points of the first midterm except for one question that required us to write out a theorem which he gave to the kids at the review session that i couldnt attend due to work

Gerardo is not a good professor because because his lectures lack simplicity, clarity, and organization. He makes frequent algebra mistakes to the extent that it feels like students are teaching the class by how many times the have to correct him. Concepts are clear as mud. Diff eqs was supposed to be easy! Not... AVOID!

He basically followed the book word-for-word, but was always willing to give in-depth explanations when asked.  Very open to questions.  He creates a great classroom atmosphere.  Very friendly and very smart, he is one of my favorite professors in the department

Decent professor with an accent. He sometimes jumbles word together, but is always willing to explain things over again. He is the type of professor that allows you to interrupt him and encourages questions. He bases most of exams off of the practice exam so easy for the students who study.
Professor Hernandez is a good guy. If you go to lecture, pay attention and do you're homework you will do fine in his class. His exams are fair as are his grading policies.

He is not a good professor, period.  He is very hard to understand because of his thick accent and teaches math to conceptually and academically without discussing any real applications of what he is teaching.  This did not inspire anyone to come to class, and not before long the lecture hall would be less than halfway full most lectures.

Very cool professor. His exams are quite easy if you do all of the homework and especially the practice exams. Does most of his math without many examples, but does very helpful review sessions before all of the exams. Overall, very great professor
